unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: What Is the Largest Confidence Level? $2$-sided Test
question_text:
A one proportion $z$-test was used to conduct a test of the null hypotheses:
$$H_0: p = 0.74 $$

$$H_A: p \neq 0.74$$
The $p$-value was $0.062$. A confidence interval for $p$ is to be constructed.
Of the following, which is the largest level of confidence for which the confidence interval will NOT contain $0.74$?
